sense.name: fill, permeate
sense.examples: Jarring disbelief infused the air on Friday. Oliver Rousseau, a Depression-era builder, infused the city with rows of romantic homes. She has infused the campus with her intellectual vigor and bold imagination.

sense.name: steep
sense.examples: Water for black tea should come to a rolling boil before infusing the tea leaves. I infused the milk with mandarin orange peel and mint leaves.

sense.name: MEDICAL: introduce into the body through a vein
sense.examples: Dr. Lamon infused the remedy into a vein in my arm with a butterfly needle and a very large syringe. When the final bag of stem cells has been infused, the IV tubing should be flushed with saline.
